definition: to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard

sentences.english: Alckmin congratulated Hu Jintao upon the great success of his visit.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾克明祝賀胡錦濤此行取得圓滿成功。

sentences.english: On the day Xie An assumed office, many officials came to congratulate him.
sentences.chinese: 謝安上任的那一天，很多官員都來祝賀。

sentences.english: I congratulate my neighbor, whose son has just won the election.
sentences.chinese: 我祝賀我的鄰居，他的兒子剛剛贏得選舉。

sentences.english: My sincere congratulations on this auspicious event of yours.
sentences.chinese: 值你倆大喜之日，謹致最誠摯的祝賀。

sentences.english: In the holiday between the relatives and friends mutually congratulates , the gift, the expression is mutually friendly.
sentences.chinese: 節日裏親友之間相互祝賀，互贈禮品，表示友好。

sentences.english: Heartiest congratulations on your splendid victory.
sentences.chinese: 衷心祝賀您取得輝煌勝利。

sentences.english: As for the congratulations from De Rossi, our friendship goes beyond football.
sentences.chinese: 至於德羅西的祝賀，我想說我們的友情超越了足球。

sentences.english: We offer our congratulations on your exam results.
sentences.chinese: 我們祝賀你考出了好成績。

sentences.english: Wrm greetings nd biggest wishes for the New Yer!
sentences.chinese: 致以猛烈的祝賀和良好的祝福，新年快樂。

sentences.english: Congratulations to you both and may the years ahead bring you continued joy and contentment.
sentences.chinese: 向你倆祝賀，願時間白叟賜賚你們長久的幸福和滿意。

sentences.english: I congratulate all of you on this achievement.
sentences.chinese: 我祝賀你們的這一成就。

sentences.english: I am happy for my teacher to congratulate the two.
sentences.chinese: 我爲我的兩位恩師高興而祝賀。

sentences.english: A friend congratulated me on my new book about my trip.
sentences.chinese: 一個朋友祝賀我出了關於我自己旅遊的新書。

sentences.english: The practice of new to the company plant represents municipal government of Suzhou of delegate of week person character congratulation.
sentences.chinese: 周人言代表姑蘇市政府對公司新工廠的歇業暗示祝賀。

sentences.english: Others are celebrations where we want to express our congratulations to someone special.
sentences.chinese: 另外一些慶祝的場合我們希望向特別的人表示祝賀。

definition: to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
to make a speech/to make some remarks
president of a club, committee etc
